These #paygap stats are harming good employers, mustering resentment, and misleading women. I fear this is going to get worse before it gets better. https:// iea.org.uk/three-nails-in -the-coffin-of-new-pay-gap-reporting-measures/ …
Who do these #paygap statistics help today? Not women - that’s for damn sure.

Consider the incentive now. If employers are going to be punished for hiring lots of women into the roles they apply for, the incentive would be to *hire fewer women*, (particularly at the graduate level, where salaries will be lowest), or contract the work out. #paygap

But no. The headlines are ’50 PER CENT GENDER #PAYGAP ’, etc, etc. *Because that’s what this rule was designed to do. Divide the genders, muster up resentment, demonize employers with deeply misleading numbers.*

If anything, Easyjet is slightly discriminating in favor of women when it comes to hiring pilots. Yet they're forced, with bogus metrics, to report a 52% gender #paygap , because 69% of their cabin crew are women, pulling the salary average down.

I predicted last year that these new rules, which don’t compare things equally, would only sour the pay gap debate further. And voila! Easyjet reporting a absolutely bogus 51.7% #paygap . Here’s why: https:// iea.org.uk/three-nails-in -the-coffin-of-new-pay-gap-reporting-measures/ …
